note.p: Education: University College School; University College, London; University College Hospital, London. BSc (1879); MD (1884)
Career: Assistant Professor of Physiology, University College, London (1883-1889); Professor of Physiology, King's College, London (1890-1923); was hemiplegic; died after an operation
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB vol 17 pp 377-379
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1932 vol 109 pp ix-xi, plate, by Sir Edward Albert Sharpey-Schafer
References: Neil Morgan, 'William Dobinson Halliburton, FRS (1860-1931). Pioneer of British Biochemistry?' in NR 1983-84 vol 38 pp 129-145, plate
